post.description:
### General Description
This API creates a new item in FactWise.

### API Validations
- The SAP_item_code should be unique
- The status of the item should be “ACTIVE”.
- Values should be according to the field type
- The preferred vendors added in the ERP_preferred_vendors list or factwise_preferred_vendors list should be present in FactWise
- The preferred vendors should be sent in either the ERP_preferred_vendors list OR the factwise_preferred_vendors list but not both.
- The name of the custom section while sending custom fields should be ‘Item details’ and the custom fields must exist on the item template.
- The additional costs being added must exist on FactWise and item template.
- The taxes being added must exist on FactWise and on the item template
- The attributes being added must exist on FactWise


### Custom Fields
- Custom fields are the fields that are not FactWise fields and that you uses for creating items
- Custom fields will be sent within a custom_fields Json object at the item level. This object contains a list of custom fields that are used for an item. [Note: The custom fields json should be within the custom_sections list with the name of the custom section as 'Item details']

put.description:
### General Description
This API updates an item in FactWise.

### API Validations
- The email id of the user modifying the state must be present in FactWise.
- Either ERP_item_code or factwise_item_code should be filled but not both.
- ERP_item_code or factwise_item_code must be present in FactWise.
- The preferred vendors added in the ERP_preferred_vendors list or factwise_preferred_vendors list should be present in FactWise
- The preferred vendors should be sent in either the ERP_preferred_vendors list OR the factwise_preferred_vendors list but not both.
- The status of the item should be “ACTIVE”.
- Values should be according to the field type
- The name of the custom section while sending custom fields should be 'Item details' and the custom fields must exist on the item template.
- The additional costs being added must exist on FactWise and item template.
- The taxes being added must exist on FactWise and on the item template
- The attributes being added must exist on FactWise

### Custom Fields
- Custom fields are the fields that are not FactWise fields and that client uses for creating items
- These fields are added as custom fields in the item template for clients to create items
- Custom fields will be sent within a custom_fields Json object at the item level. This object contains a list of custom fields that are used for an item. [Note: The custom fields json should be within the custom_sections list with the name of the custom section as 'Item details']

### General Description
This API updates the status of the item in FactWise.

### API Validations
- The email id of the user modifying the state must be present in FactWise.
- Either ERP_item_code or factwise_item_code should be filled but not both.
- Either ERP_item_code or factwise_item_code must be present in FactWise
- The item should exist in FactWise
- The item status should be ‘ACTIVE’
- Values should be according to the field type.

post.description:
### General Description
This API creates a new purchase order in Factwise.

### API Validations
 - The email used to create the purchase order must be present in the Factwise as a user of the particular entity/enterprise. 
 - The items added in ERP_item_code or factwise_item_code should be present in the Factwise.
 - The status of the item should be “ACTIVE”.
 - The status of the vendors should be “ACTIVE”.
 - Values should be according to the field type
- The vendors added in the ERP_preferred_vendors field or factwise_preferred_vendors field should be present in FactWise
- The preferred vendors should be sent in either the ERP_preferred_vendors list OR the factwise_preferred_vendors list but not both.
- The name of the custom section while sending custom fields should be 'PO Group Details', 'Item Terms', 'Payment and Delivery Terms', and 'Additional Details'. Also, the custom fields must exist on the PO group template.
- The additional costs being added must exist on FactWise and PO Group template.
- The taxes being added must exist on FactWise and on the PO Group template
 - The accepted_date cannot be before the issue_date.
 - Vendor Information : All the custom fields related to vendors must be sent here.
 - The project/cost center/GL code should exist on FactWise.
 - The sum of allocation_percentage within the deliverable_payment_terms json should be 100.
 - The applied_from_milestone within the deliverable_payment_terms json should send the options as defined in the PO template.

put.description:
### General Description
This API updates an existing purchase order in Factwise.

### API Validations
 - The email used to update the purchase order must be present in the Factwise as a user of the particular entity/enterprise. 
 - The ERP_po_id/factwise_po_id should exist on FactWise.
 - The items added in ERP_item_code or factwise_item_code should be present in the Factwise.
 - The status of the item should be “ACTIVE”.
 - The status of the vendors should be “ACTIVE”.
 - Values should be according to the field type
- The vendors added in the ERP_preferred_vendors field or factwise_preferred_vendors field should be present in FactWise
- The preferred vendors should be sent in either the ERP_preferred_vendors list OR the factwise_preferred_vendors list but not both.
- The name of the custom section while sending custom fields should be 'PO Group Details', 'Item Terms', 'Payment and Delivery Terms', and 'Additional Details'. Also, the custom fields must exist on the PO group template.
- The additional costs being added must exist on FactWise and PO Group template.
- The taxes being added must exist on FactWise and on the PO Group template
 - The accepted_date cannot be before the issue_date.
 - Vendor Information : All the custom fields related to vendors must be sent here.
 - The project/cost center/GL code should exist on FactWise.
 - The sum of allocation_percentage within the deliverable_payment_terms json should be 100.
 - The applied_from_milestone within the deliverable_payment_terms json should send the options as defined in the PO template.

### General Description
This API updates the status of an existing purchase order in Factwise.

### API Validations
- The ERP_po_id/factwise_po_id should exist on FactWise.
- The status of the PO should be ‘ISSUED’

### General Description
This API terminates an ongoing purchase order in Factwise.

### API Validations
 - The email used to update the purchase order must be present in the Factwise as a user of the particular entity/enterprise. 
 - The status of the PO should be “ONGOING”.
 - Values should be according to the field type
 - The ERP_po_id/factwise_po_id should exist on FactWise.
 - The PO ID should be sent in either the ERP_po_id OR the factwise_po_id list but not both
 - The status of the PO should be ‘ISSUED’

post.description:
This API creates a new project in FactWise.

### API Validations
- Either the project_code or the ERP_project_code must be provided.
- The project_code must be unique within the enterprise.
- The ERP_project_code must be unique.
- The created_by_user_email is mandatory and must be in a valid email format.
- The user associated with the created_by_user_email must exist in the enterprise.
- The user associated with the created_by_user_email must have permissions for project creation.
- If provided, the customer_code must exist in the enterprise customer directory.
- If provided, the template_name must exist in FactWise.
- The template_name provided must be in an "active" state.
- The value for project_status must be one of the following: DRAFT, SUBMITTED, EXPIRED.

### Custom Fields
- Custom fields are user-defined fields that are not standard FactWise fields but are configured within a project template.
- All custom fields must be sent within a custom_fields list. This list should be placed inside the appropriate custom_sections object, as defined in the template.
- The value for a custom field is considered optional unless the field has been marked as mandatory in the project template.

### General Description
This api creates a new contact for a particular vendor.
### API Validations
 - The factwise_vendor_code or ERP_vendor_code must exist on FactWise.
 - Either factwise_vendor_code or ERP_vendor_code must be filled but not both.
 - The entity_name must be valid and present in the FactWise.

delete.description:
###General Description
This api deletes a contact from a particular vendor details.

 ### API Validations
 - The factwise_vendor_code or ERP_vendor_code must exist on FactWise.
 - Either factwise_vendor_code or ERP_vendor_code must be filled but not both.
 - The entity_name must be valid and present in the FactWise.

put.description:
###General Description
This api updates a contact information for a particular vendor.

### API Validations 
 - The factwise_vendor_code or ERP_vendor_code must exist on FactWise.
 - Either factwise_vendor_code or ERP_vendor_code must be filled but not both.
 - The entity_name must be valid and present in the FactWise.

post.description:
### General Description
This API creates a vendor in FactWise.

### API Validations
- The email id of the user creating the vendor must be present in FactWise.
- The ERP_vendor_code should be unique.
- Values should be according to the field type.
- The name of the custom section while sending custom fields should be 'Vendor details' and the custom fields must exist on the vendor template.
- The additional costs being added must exist on FactWise and vendor template.
- The taxes being added must exist on FactWise and on the vendor template.
- Duplicate emails should not be sent for any of the contacts for the same vendor entity.

### Custom Fields
- Custom fields are the fields that are not FactWise fields and that client uses for creating vendors
- These fields are added as custom fields in the vendor template for clients to create vendors
- Custom fields will be sent within a custom_fields Json object at the item level. This object contains a list of custom fields that are used for an vendor. [Note: The custom fields json should be within the custom_sections list with the name of the custom section as 'Vendor details'.]

put.description:
###General Description
This api disables the vendor in vendor directory.

### API Validations
 - User email must be valid and present in the FactWise.
 - The factwise_vendor_code or ERP_vendor_code must be valid and must exist on FactWsie.
 - The status should be ‘ACTIVE’

###General Description
This api updates the state of a vendor. 

### API Validations
- The email id of the user creating the vendor must be present in FactWise.
- The ERP_vendor_code should be unique.
- The ERP_vendor_code should exist in FactWise
- Values should be according to the field type.
- The name of the custom section while sending custom fields should be 'Vendor details' and the custom fields must exist on the vendor template.
- The additional costs being added must exist on FactWise and vendor template.
- The taxes being added must exist on FactWise and on the vendor template.

### Custom Fields
- Custom fields are the fields that are not FactWise fields and that client uses for creating vendors
- These fields are added as custom fields in the vendor template for clients to create vendors
- Custom fields will be sent within a custom_fields Json object at the item level. This object contains a list of custom fields that are used for an vendor. [Note: The custom fields json should be within the custom_sections list with the name of the custom section as 'Vendor details'.]

post.description:
### General Description
This API creates a new contract in FactWise.

### API Validations
- The ERP_contract_code should be unique
- The status of the item added to the contract should be “ACTIVE”.
- Values should be according to the field type
- The ERP_vendor_code/factwise_vendor_code should exist on FactWise.
- The vendors added in the ERP_vendor_code list or factwise_vendor_code list should be active
- The ERP_item_code/factwise_item_code of the items being added must exist on FactWise.
- The vendors should be sent in either the ERP_vendor_code list OR the factwise_vendor_code list but not both.
- All the custom fields must be sent in one of the following sections: 
- Contract Details : All the custom fields for the overall contract must be sent here 
- Item Terms: All the custom fields related to item terms for the items must be sent here 
- Vendor Details: All the custom fields related to vendors must be sent here 
- Payment and Delivery Terms: All the custom fields related to payment and delivery terms for the items must be sent here. 
- Terms and Conditions: All the custom fields related to the terms and conditions for the Contract must be sent here.
- The custom fields being sent in any of sections must exist in the Contract template
- The additional costs being added must exist on FactWise as well as the Contract template
- The taxes being added must exist on FactWise as well as the Contract template
- The attributes being added must exist on FactWise
- The project code should exist on FactWise
- The sum of allocation_percentage within the deliverable_payment_terms JSON should be 100
- The applied_from_milestone within the deliverable_payment_terms json should send the options as defined in the Contract template


### Custom Fields
- Custom fields are the fields that are not FactWise fields and that the user can create.
- These fields can be added as custom fields in the contract template.
- Custom fields will be sent within a custom_fields Json object at the overall or item level. This object contains a list of custom fields that are used for creating the contract. [Note: The custom fields json should be within the custom_sections list with the name of the custom section as mentioned in the template.

put.description:
### General Description
This API update an existing contract in FactWise.

### API Validations
- ERP_contract_id/factwise_contract_id should exist on FactWise
- The status of the item added to the contract should be “ACTIVE”.
- Values should be according to the field type
- The ERP_vendor_code/factwise_vendor_code should exist on FactWise.
- The vendors added in the ERP_vendor_code list or factwise_vendor_code list should be active
- The vendors should be sent in either the ERP_vendor_code list OR the factwise_vendor_code list.
- All the custom fields must be sent in one of the following sections: 
- Contract Details : All the custom fields for the overall contract must be sent here 
- Item Terms: All the custom fields for the items related to item terms must be sent here 
- Vendor Details: All the custom fields related to vendors must be sent here 
- Payment and Delivery Terms: All the custom fields related to payment and delivery terms for the items must be sent here. 
- Terms and Conditions: All the custom fields related to the terms and conditions for the Contract must be sent here. 
- The custom fields being sent in any of sections must exist in the Contract template
- The additional costs being added must exist on FactWise and contract template.
- The taxes being added must exist on FactWise and on the contract template.
- The project code should exist on FactWise
- The attributes being added must exist on FactWise
- The sum of allocation_percentage within the deliverable_payment_terms JSON should be 100.
- The applied_from_milestone within the deliverable_payment_terms json should send the options as defined in the Contract template.

### Custom Fields
- Custom fields are the fields that are not FactWise fields and that the user can create.
- These fields can be added as custom fields in the contract template.
- Custom fields will be sent within a custom_fields Json object at the overall or item level. This object contains a list of custom fields that are used for updating the contract. [Note: The custom fields json should be within the custom_sections list with the name of the custom section as mentioned in the template.

### General Description
This API update the state of an existing contract only in FactWise.

### API Validations
- ERP_contract_id/factwise_contract_id should exist on FactWise 
- The status of the contract should be ‘ISSUED’

post.description:
### General Description
This API creates a new requisition in FactWise.

### API Validations
- The ERP_requisition_code should be unique
- The ERP_item_code/factwise_item_code of the items being added must exist on FactWise.
- The status of the item added to the requisition should be “ACTIVE”.
- Values should be according to the field type
- The vendors added in the ERP_vendor_codes list or factwise_vendor_codes list should be present in FactWise
- The vendors should be sent in either the ERP_vendor_code list OR the factwise_vendor_code list but not both.
- All the custom fields must be sent in one of the following sections: 
- Requisition Details : All the custom fields for the overall requisition must be sent here. 
- Item Terms: All the custom fields related to item terms for the items must be sent here. 
- Vendor Information: All the custom fields related to vendors must be sent here. 
- Payment and Delivery Terms: All the custom fields related to payment and delivery terms for the items must be sent here. 
- Additional Information: All the custom fields related to additional details for the items must be sent here.
- The custom fields being sent in any of the sections must exist in the Requisition template.
- The additional costs being added must exist on FactWise and requisition template.
- The taxes being added must exist on FactWise and on the requisition template
- The project code should exist on FactWise.
- The attributes being added must exist on FactWise
- The sum of allocation_percentage within the deliverable_payment_terms JSON should be 100.
- The applied_from_milestone within the deliverable_payment_terms json should send the options as defined in the Requisition template.
- 

### Custom Fields
- Custom fields are the fields that are not FactWise fields and that the user can create.
- These fields can be added as custom fields in the requisition template.
- Custom fields will be sent within a custom_fields Json object at the overall or item level. This object contains a list of custom fields that are used for creating the requisition. [Note: The custom fields json should be within the custom_sections list with the name of the custom section as mentioned in the template.

put.description:
### General Description
This API updates an existing requisition in FactWise.

### API Validations
- The ERP_requisition_id/factwise_requisition_id should exist on FactWise.
- The ERP_item_code/factwise_item_code of the items being added must exist on FactWise.
- The vendors added in the ERP_vendor_codes list or factwise_vendor_codes list should be present in FactWise
- The vendors should be sent in either the ERP_vendor_codes list OR the factwise_vendor_codes list but not both.
- The project code should exist on FactWise.
- The sum of allocation_percentage within the deliverable_payment_terms json should be 100.
- The applied_from_milestone within the deliverable_payment_terms json should send the options as defined in the Requisition template.
- All the custom fields must be sent in one of the following sections: 
  - Requisition Details : All the custom fields for the overall requisition must be sent here. 
  - Item Terms: All the custom fields related to item terms for the items must be sent here. 
  - Vendor Information: All the custom fields related to vendors must be sent here. 
  - Payment and Delivery Terms: All the custom fields related to payment and delivery terms for the items must be sent here. 
  - Additional Information: All the custom fields related to additional details for the items must be sent here.
- The custom fields being sent in any of the sections must exist in the Requisition template.
- The additional costs being added must exist on FactWise as well as the Requisition template.
- The taxes being added must exist on FactWise as well as the Requisition template.

### General Description
This API terminates an existing requisition in FactWise.

### API Validations
- The ERP_requisition_id/factwise_requisition_id should exist on FactWise.
- The requisition status should be ‘SUBMITTED’ or ‘ONGOING’.

get.description:
### General Description
This API fetches quote data from FactWise that has already been created on the FactWise platform. It is used by external systems to sync or consume quote information and does not create or modify any data.

**Q: Does this API create a new quote in FactWise?**
No. All quotes are created manually within the FactWise web platform. This API is strictly read-only and only returns existing quotes.

**Q: Is a request payload required to call this API?**
No. This API does not accept or process any request body. All inputs are provided via query parameters in the URL.

**Q: What are the required query parameters?**
The API requires start_datetime and end_datetime to define the time range for which quote data should be fetched.

**Q: What format should start_datetime and end_datetime be in?**
Both parameters must be in ISO 8601 datetime format and must be provided in UTC timezone, using the Z suffix.

**Q: What does the time range represent?**
The API returns quotes that were last modified within the provided time window.

**Q: What happens if no quotes exist in the given time range?**
The API returns a successful response with no quote data. This is expected behavior and does not indicate an error.

**Q: Can this API be called multiple times with overlapping time ranges?**
Yes. The API is idempotent. Calling it multiple times with the same or overlapping time windows will return the same data and will not create duplicates on the FactWise side.

**Q: How should SFDC handle duplicate quotes returned across multiple calls?**
SFDC should use the FactWise quote identifier provided in the response to uniquely identify and deduplicate records.

**Q: Are all fields in the response always present?**
No. Some fields may be null, empty, or omitted depending on how the quote was created in FactWise. Integrations should not assume that every field is always populated.

**Q: What does the costing_sheet_items data represent?**
It represents the commercial line items of a quote, including item details, quantities, pricing, and lead times. This data is read-only and provided for integration purposes.

**Q: How are attachments returned in the API response?**
Attachments are returned as secure download URLs pointing to the FactWise Attachments API. Each URL represents a file associated with the quote or a quote item.

**Q: Are these attachment URLs publicly accessible?**
No. The attachment URLs are private and protected. They cannot be accessed directly without authentication.

**Q: How should SFDC download an attachment from the provided URL?**
SFDC must call the attachment download URL as a separate API request and include the same API authentication credentials (API keys) that were provided for accessing FactWise APIs.

**Q: Do attachment URLs expire?**
The URLs are stable but access-controlled. As long as the requesting system has valid API credentials, the attachment can be downloaded.

**Q: Can this API be used to update a quote or change its status?**
No. This API does not support updates, edits, or status transitions. All such actions must be performed within the FactWise platform.

**Q: What happens if invalid datetime values are passed in the URL?**
The API returns an error response indicating that the request is invalid. Ensure that datetime values are correctly formatted and in UTC.

**Q: Is this API suitable for scheduled or automated SFDC jobs?**
Yes. The API is designed to be called by scheduled jobs or background processes for periodic data synchronization.

**Q: What is the recommended approach for syncing quotes into SFDC?**
SFDC should store the timestamp of the last successful sync and use it as the start time for the next API call, with the current time as the end time.

**Q: What should be checked before raising a support request?**
Verify that the quote exists in the FactWise UI, confirm the provided time range and timezone, and ensure the API URL and parameters are correct.

parameters.name: start_datetime
parameters.description: Start datetime in ISO 8601 format (UTC, e.g., YYYY-MM-DDT00:00:00Z)

parameters.name: end_datetime
parameters.description: End datetime in ISO 8601 format (UTC, e.g., YYYY-MM-DDT00:00:00Z)

put.description:
Creates a permanent mapping between a Factwise Costing Sheet and the corresponding ERP ID.

The costing sheet is always created in FactWise. After the quote is generated in Factwise, this endpoint is called to update the ERP ID of that existing quote.

The API can process records in bulk and returns a per-record result.

If a costing sheet already has an ERP ID mapped, that record is rejected while other records continue processing (multi-status response).

This endpoint does not create or update costing sheet data.

schema.description: Per-record result of the mapping process.

CostSourceEnum.description:
* `ITEM` - ITEM
* `VENDOR` - VENDOR
* `BUYER` - BUYER
* `FORMULA` - FORMULA
* `DEFAULT` - DEFAULT
* `BOM` - BOM

project_code.description: A unique Factwise code assigned to the project. Must be unique and not exceed 100 characters. Either this or ERP_project_code is required.

ERP_project_code.description: The ERP project code. Must be unique and not exceed 200 characters. Either this or project_code is required.

created_by_user_email.description: Email address of a valid user in the enterprise with project creation permissions.

customer_code.description: Code of the customer entity associated with this project. Must exist in the enterprise customer directory.

project_name.description: Title of the project. Cannot be only whitespace and must not exceed 200 characters.

entity_name.description: Name of an existing entity in the enterprise.

description.description: A detailed description of the project, not exceeding 2000 characters.

internal_notes.description: Private notes for internal team use, not exceeding 2000 characters.

validity_from.description: The start date from which the project becomes valid. Must be a valid datetime.

validity_to.description: The end date until which the project remains valid. Must be a valid datetime and after validity_from.

template_name.description: Name of an active and existing project template in FactWise.

custom_sections.description: A list of custom sections, each containing a set of custom fields and their values as defined in the template.

CreateProjectAPIInput.description:
### API Validations
- Either the project_code or the ERP_project_code must be provided.
- The project_code must be unique within the enterprise.
- The ERP_project_code must be unique.
- The created_by_user_email is mandatory and must be in a valid email format.
- The user associated with the created_by_user_email must exist in the enterprise.
- The user associated with the created_by_user_email must have permissions for project creation.
- If provided, the customer_code must exist in the enterprise customer directory.
- If provided, the template_name must exist in FactWise.
- The template_name provided must be in an "active" state.
- The value for project_status must be one of the following: DRAFT, SUBMITTED, EXPIRED.

### Custom Fields
- Custom fields are user-defined fields that are not standard FactWise fields but are configured within a project template.
- All custom fields must be sent within a custom_fields list. This list should be placed inside the appropriate custom_sections object, as defined in the template.
- The value for a custom field is considered optional unless the field has been marked as mandatory in the project template.

projects.description: List of projects to be created in bulk

created_by_user_email.description: Email of the user creating the item.The user email should exist in the enterprise for which the item is getting created.

name.description: Name of the Item to be added.

ERP_item_code.description: The ERP item code of the item that is being created. It should be unique for all new created item.

internal_notes.description: Internal notes related to the item

measurement_units.description: Code of th units which will be used to measure the quantity of the item

attributes.description: Any particular specification that is associated with the item.

is_buyer.description: Whether the item is to be bought

buyer_pricing_information.description: Information related to the currency, price, and any additional cost of the item.

is_seller.description: Whether the item is to be sold

seller_pricing_information.description: Information related to the currency, price, and any additional cost of the item.

custom_ids.description: Any custom identification that is attached to the item

tags.description: Any tags associated with the item.

entities.description: The entity for which the item is added.

custom_sections.description: All the custom fields must be sent in one of the Item Details sections.

items.description: List of items to be created in bulk

vendors.description: List of vendors to be created in bulk

modified_by_user_email.description: Email of the user updating the vendor.The user email should exist in the enterprise for which the vendor is getting updated.

vendor_name.description: The name of the vendor which is getting updated/The updated name.

tags.description: The tags associated with the vendor/Updated tags for the vendor.

seller_address_information.description: The information about the address of the seller as full address

seller_identifications.description: The details of the identifications used to verify the vendor.

additional_costs.description: Information related to any additional cost involved with the vendor.

custom_sections.description: All the custom fields must be sent in one of the Vendor Details sections.

entities.description: The entity for which the vendor is added.

vendors.description: List of vendors to be updated in bulk

modified_by_user_email.description: The email ID of the user who is disabling the vendor.

vendors.description: List of vendors to be disabled in bulk

created_by_user_email.description: The email ID of the user who is creating the vendor contact.

factwise_vendor_code.description: The FactWise vendor code for which the contact is being created.

ERP_vendor_code.description: The ERP vendor code for which the contact is being created.

primary_email.description: The primary email of the contact that is being created.

phone_numbers.description: The phone number of the contact that is being added to the vendor.

vendor_contacts.description: List of vendor contacts to be created in bulk

modified_by_user_email.description: The email ID of the user who is updating the vendor contact.

factwise_vendor_code.description: The FactWise vendor code for which the contact is being updated.

ERP_vendor_code.description: The ERP vendor code for which the contact is being updated.

primary_email.description: The primary email of the contact that is being updated.

phone_numbers.description: The phone number of the contact that is being updated.

vendor_contacts.description: List of vendor contacts to be updated in bulk

deleted_by_user_email.description: The email ID of the user who is deleting the vendor contact.

ERP_vendor_code.description: The ERP vendor code for which the contact is being deleted.

factwise_vendor_code.description: The FactWise vendor code for which the contact is being deleted.

primary_email.description: The primary email of the contact that is being deleted.

vendor_contacts.description: List of vendor contacts to be deleted in bulk

billing_address_id.description: The nickname of the address of the buyer.

shipping_address_id.description: The nickname of the address of the buyer.

identifications.description: The name of the identification of the buyer.

contacts.description: The phone number of the buyer.

ERP_vendor_code.description: The ERP vendor code of the vendor to which the PO will be send.

factwise_vendor_code.description: The FactWise vendor code of the vendor to which the PO will be send.

seller_full_address.description: The information about the address of the seller as full address

identifications.description: The name of the identification of the buyer.

contacts.description: The phone number of the buyer.

ERP_po_id.description: The ERP PO ID created for the PO. This must be unique for new PO creation.

created_by_user_email.description: Email of the user creating the Purchase Order.The user email should exist in the enterprise for which the Purchase Order is getting created.

status.description: The status of the created PO.

template_name.description: The name of the template used to create the PO. Make sure that the template is published.

issue_date.description: The date at which the PO is created.

accepted_date.description: The date at which the PO is accepted.

currency_code.description: The currency code to enter the currency that is used to create the PO

notes.description: Any note that the user wants to add related to the PO

event.description: The event ID that is used to create the PO or leave blank if the PO is created directly.

terms_and_conditions_id.description: The ID of the terms and conditions used for the PO.

data.description: The data which is added into the terms and conditions.

name.description: Name of the terms and conditions that is used in the PO.

additional_costs.description: The name and additional cost applied to the overall PO.

taxes.description: The name and value of the taxes applied to the overall PO

discounts.description: The value of the discount applied to the overall PO.

custom_sections.description:
All the custom fields must be sent in one of the following sections-
-	PO Group Details-> All the custom fields for the overall direct PO must be sent here
-	Item Terms-> All the custom fields related to item terms for the items must be sent here.
-	Payment and Delivery Terms-> All the custom fields related to payment and delivery terms for the items must be sent here.
-	Additional Details-> All the custom fields related to the additional details for the PO must be sent here.
-	The custom fields being sent in any of sections must exist in the PO Group template

ERP_item_code.description: The ERP item code of the item that is going to be included in the PO.

factwise_item_code.description: The FactWise item code of the item that is going to be added in the PO.

item_additional_details.description: Any additional details related to the item entered in the PO.

internal_notes.description: Any internal note the user wants to add related to the item in the PO only internal team memebers can see.

external_notes.description: Any notes about the note that the user wants the external person to see

price.description: The price of the item added in the PO.

additional_costs.description: The name and additional cost applied to the item in PO.

taxes.description: The name and value of the taxes applied to the item in PO

discounts.description: The value of the discount applied to the item in PO.

measurement_unit.description: The code of the measurement unit that is valid for the item added in the PO.

quantity.description: The quantity of the item that is added in the PO.

incoterm.description: The name of the incoterm being used for the item in the PO.

prepayment_percentage.description: The percentage for which the pre-payment will be done or has been done.

custom_sections.description:
All the custom fields must be sent in one of the following sections-
-	PO Group Details-> All the custom fields for the overall direct PO must be sent here
-	Item Terms-> All the custom fields related to item terms for the items must be sent here.
-	Payment and Delivery Terms-> All the custom fields related to payment and delivery terms for the items must be sent here.
-	Additional Details-> All the custom fields related to the additional details for the PO must be sent here.
-	The custom fields being sent in any of sections must exist in the PO Group template

notes.description: Optional notes about the status change.

purchase_orders.description: List of purchase orders whose status needs to be updated in bulk

modified_by_user_email.description: Email of the user updating the Purchase Order.The user email should exist in the enterprise for which the Purchase Order is getting updated.

factwise_po_id.description: The factwise PO ID for which the status is being updated.

contract_end_date.description: The date on which the contract will end.

entity_name.description: The name of the entity for which the contract is being created.

status.description: The status of the contract that is being created.

buyer_address.description: Nick name of the buyer address must be used

factwise_vendor_code.description: Either this of ERP_vendor_code is required

vendor_identifications.description: Identification must be present in Factwise

custom_sections.description:
All the custom fields must be sent in one of the following sections-
-	Contract Details-> All the custom fields for the overall contract must be sent here
-	Item Terms-> All the custom fields related to item terms for the items must be sent here
-	Vendor Details-> All the custom fields related to vendors must be sent here
-	Payment and Delivery Terms-> All the custom fields related to payment and delivery terms for the items must be sent here.
-	Terms and Conditions-> All the custom fields related to the terms and conditions for the Contract must be sent here.
-	The custom fields being sent in any of sections must exist in the Contract template

factwise_contract_id.description: ERP code should be valid. The contract should be in SUBMITTED state only

requisition_name.description: Name of the requisition. Must be unique and cannot exceed 200 characters

ERP_requisition_id.description: ERP code of the requisition.Must be unique and not exceed 200 characters

currency_code_id.description: Currency code ID for the requisition. Should be a valid UUID

entity_name.description: Name of the entity for which the requisition is being created.

template_name.description: Name of the template being used for creating the requisition

project_code.description: Project code of the project for the requisition. The project code should exist

notes.description: Notes for the requisition. Cannot exceed 1000 characters.

created_by_user_email.description: Email of the user creating the Requisition.The user email should exist in the enterprise for which the Requisition is getting created.

custom_sections.description:
-	All the custom fields must be sent in one of the following sections-
-	Requisition Details-> All the custom fields for the overall requisition must be sent here
-	Item Terms-> All the custom fields related to item terms for the items must be sent here
-	Vendor Details-> All the custom fields related to vendors must be sent here
-	Payment and Delivery Terms-> All the custom fields related to payment and delivery terms for the items must be sent here.
-	Additional Information-> All the custom fields related to the additional information for the Requisition must be sent here.
-	The custom fields being sent in any of sections must exist in the Requisition template

requisitions.description: List of requisitions to be created in bulk

ERP_requisition_id.description: ERP Requisition ID to be updated.The ERP requisition ID must exist. The ERP requisition ID should exist. Either ERP requisition ID or FactWise requisition ID is required.

factwise_requisition_id.description: FactWise Requisition ID to be updated. The FactWise requisition ID must exist. The ERP requisition ID should exist. Either ERP requisition ID or FactWise requisition ID is required.

requisition_name.description: Name of the requisition. Cannot exceed 200 characters

currency_code_id.description: Currency code for the requisition. Should be a valid UUID

entity_name.description: Name of the entity associated with the requisition. The entity name should be valid.

project_code.description: Project code associated with the requisition. Project code must exist.

modified_by_user_email.description: Email of the user modifying the Requisition. The email of the user should exist on FactWise.

factwise_item_code.description: The factwise item code of the item that is going to be updated.

items.description: List of items whose status needs to be updated in bulk

modified_by_user_email.description: Email id of the user terminating the requisition.

ERP_requisition_id.description: ERP requisition ID of the requisition being terminated. The ERP requisition ID should exist. Either ERP requisition ID or FactWise requisition ID is required.

factwise_requisition_id.description: FactWise requisition ID of the requisition being terminated. The FactWise requisition ID should exist. Either ERP requisition ID or FactWise requisition ID is required.

CreatePurchaseOrderStatusEnum.description:
* `ISSUED` - Purchase Ordered is ISSUED
* `ONGOING` - Purchase Order is ONGOING

CreateEnterpriseContractAPIInputStatusEn.description:
* `DRAFT` - Contract in draft state
* `SUBMITTED` - Contract in submitted state

CreateEnterpriseRequisitionAPIInputStatu.description:
* `DRAFT` - Requisition is in draft state
* `SUBMITTED` - Requisition is in submitted state
* `Ongoing` - Requisition is in ongoing state
* `Terminated` - Requisition has been terminated

TerminatePurchaseOrderAPIInputStatusEnum.description:
* `ACCEPTED` - The request to terminate a PO will be accepted by the seller.
* `REQUESTED` - A request have been made to terminate the PO by buyer.
* `REVOKED` - The request to terminate a PO is been revoked by the seller.

UpdateEnterpriseContractAPIInputStatusEn.description:
* `DRAFT` - Update contract to draft state
* `SUBMITTED` - Update contract to submitted state
* Cannot update the contract status from `Submitted` to `Draft`.

TerminateEnterpriseContractAPIInputStatu.description: * `TERMINATED` - Contract is terminated and cannot be used again

custom_sections.description:
-	All the custom fields must be sent in one of the following sections-
-	Contract Details-> All the custom fields for the overall contract must be sent here
-	Vendor Details-> All the custom fields related to vendors must be sent here
-	Payment and Delivery Terms-> All the custom fields related to payment and delivery terms for the items must be sent here.
-	Essential Terms-> All the custom fields related to the essential terms for the contract must be sent here.
-	The custom fields being sent in any of sections must exist in the Contract lifecycle management template

name.description: Name of the quote. Should be unique. Length should not be greater than 100 characters.

seller_entity_name.description: Entity name should exist in the enterprise. Length should not be greater than 500 characters.

template_name.description: The template name should exist in FactWise. Length should not be greater than 100 characters.

items.description: Each email length should not be greater than 254 characters.

customer_entity_name.description: Entity name of the customer. Length should not be greater than 500 characters.

project_code.description: Project code. Length should not be greater than 100 characters.

status.description: Status should be within DRAFT, SUBMITTED, APPROVED.

created_by_user_email.description: Email of the creator. Length should not be greater than 254 characters.

modified_by_user_email.description: Email of the modifier. Length should not be greater than 254 characters.

section_type.description: Section type. Length should not be greater than 10 characters.

value.description: Value of the custom field. Length should not be greater than 1000 characters.

name.description: Name of the item. Length should not be greater than 300 characters.

lead_time_period.description: Period type. Length should not be greater than 10 characters.

quantity.description: Cannot be negative. Up to 30 digits with 10 decimal places.

rate.description: Cannot be negative. Up to 30 digits with 10 decimal places.

vendor_entity_name.description: Name of the vendor entity. Length should not be greater than 500 characters.

vendor_rate.description: Cannot be negative. Up to 30 digits with 10 decimal places.

factwise_project_id.description: Project id should exist on FactWise.

email.description: Email length should not be greater than 254 characters.

total.description: Cannot be negative. Up to 30 digits with 10 decimal places.
